page.title: 14Change in the Area.
page.content: Mrs Pow and Mrs Mills, dinner ladies at the local school, have lived in the area since birth. They recalled how the village has changed in the last 30 yrs. Until the 1950's there was no mains water. People used a pump sited opposite the school. There was a small shop at 41 Doreen Cotts until 1971. Supermarket competition in Trowbridge closed it down. The P.O. at no.40 ran until 1979. It closed because no permanent replacement could be found when the post mistress Miss Mead died. There was a weekly bus service to Trowbridge until 1979. They remember the village as being more sociable when they were young. On Sundays the church was full, because most people were employed on the Rood Ashton Estate and were oblig- ed to attend.They enjoyed the services
